intro: Hieracium radiodens, commonly known as the radiodense hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a dense, flat-topped cluster. Hieracium radiodens is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
